snippet: The museum is dedicated to a long-ago venture to compile and index knowledge in a giant card catalog with millions of entries — an analog-era equivalent of Google itself.
abstract: Google is forming a partnership with the Mundaneum museum in Mons, Belgium, dedicated to a long-ago venture to compile and index knowledge in a giant card catalog with millions of entries--an analog-era equivalent of Google itself; partnership is part of a broader campaign by Google to demonstrate it is a friend of European culture, at a time when its services are being investigated by regulators on a variety of fronts.
lead_paragraph: The museum is dedicated to a long-ago venture to compile and index knowledge in a giant card catalog with millions of entries — an analog-era equivalent of Google itself.

headline.main: Google to Announce Venture With Belgian Museum
headline.print_headline: Google Links With an Ancestor, A Belgian Trove of Paper Data
